intro: Polyaulax cylindrocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited polyaulax, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to Australia, characterized by its woody stems and small, palmate leaves. The plant produces cylindrical, woody fruits that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
